title: Puzzle Night
description: Come hang out with us to kick off the semester! There will be the funny arithmetic sudokus, the 24 game, a bunch of logic puzzles, and possibly more, or you can just come and chat. Come help us kick off the year with some fun!

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: REU Discussions and Advising
description: An REU is a research experience for undergraduates, usually held during the summer. Our club members Katherine and Ophelia will discuss their REU experiences this past summer, as well as giving advice for those interested in doing an REU.

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: Ice Cream Social
description: The ice cream social is an event held every semester by BUMA. Come to chill, chat about math, and have some good ice cream.

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: A Friendly Introduction to Abstract Nonsense
description: Our club member Grant Talbert will give an introduction to category theory, which is a beautiful unifying language for mathematics. He will define the elementary notions of categories, functors, natural transformations, and universals, with motivation pulled from basic set theory and algebra. Basic knowledge of sets and functions is recommended. Lecture Notes.

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: Photon Collab: Trivia Night
description: BUMA is collaborating with Photon, the BU Physics club! We will be joining them for a trivia night. There will be questions about both math and physics, and we will try to make those questions accessible to everyone. Prizes will be given to the winners!

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: polygons
description: Our club member Yoga is going to give an interesting talk about polygons. When asked to describe the talk, he responded with only "polygons".

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: Estimathon
description: Our club member Alex is hosting an estimathon! This is a competitive event where you must estimate extremely large numbers, and whoever is closest wins! Prizes will be available.

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: Course Registration Advice
description: With course registration right around the corner, drop by for advice on what math courses to register for. We will go over the available courses for next semester, and will offer advice for anyone who is wondering what courses they want to take.

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: Book Club
description: We will be hosting a math book club! We will be reading A Mathematician's Lament, by Paul Lockhart. This is a wonderful short article criticizing mathematics education for failing to teach the beauty of mathematics, and instead pushing for rote memorization.

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: \(L^1\) Geometry
description: Our club member Katherine Guo will talk about \(L^1\) geometry. We will introduce the notion of a metric as an abstraction of distance, with particular emphasis on the \(L^p\) metrics. Focusing on the special case of \(L^1\), we will explore common geometric constructions and divergences from standard results in Euclidean (\(L^2\)) geometry.

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: What is a quasi-category?
description: Our club member Grant Talbert will give a talk on quasi-categories, which are excellent models for \((\infty,1)\)-categories. In this talk, we will introduce the elementary theory of simplicial sets, which we will use to define quasi-categories. We will conclude by exploring what \((\infty,1)\)-categories look like. Lecture notes will be linked when available.

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: Integration Techniques
description: To prepare for the Integration Bee next week, our club member Yoga will teach advanced integration tricks and techniques often used on integration bee problems. This is a great way to have fun while honing your calculus skills before finals!

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: Integration Bee
description: The time has finally come! The Integration Bee, modeled off of MIT's annual Integration Bee, is a fun competition to see who is the best at integration. Even if you don't want to participate, you can still come make fun of physicists as they fail Gaussians (somehow)!
